Development Setup

Guide for setting up your development environment.

Prerequisitesâ€‹

  • Node.js 20+ (use nvm use to switch versions automatically)
  • Yarn 1.22.22 (specified in package.json)
  • Git
  • A code editor (VS Code recommended)

Installationâ€‹

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/ICJIA/icjia-accessibility-status.git
cd icjia-accessibility-status

# Install dependencies
yarn install

# Install docs dependencies
cd docs && yarn install && cd ..

Development Commandsâ€‹

Running All Servicesâ€‹

# Start frontend, backend, and docs concurrently
yarn dev

This starts:

  • Frontend: http://localhost:5173
  • Backend: http://localhost:3001
  • Docs: http://localhost:3002

Running Individual Servicesâ€‹

# Frontend only
yarn dev:frontend

# Backend only
yarn dev:backend

# Docs only
yarn dev:docs

Buildingâ€‹

# Build all services
yarn build

# Build frontend only
yarn build:frontend

# Build docs only
yarn build:docs

Code Qualityâ€‹

# Run ESLint
yarn lint

# Run TypeScript type checking
yarn typecheck

# Run both
yarn lint && yarn typecheck

Project Structureâ€‹

icjia-accessibility-status/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/                          # React frontend
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/              # Reusable React components
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pages/                   # Page components
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ contexts/                # React context providers
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lib/                     # Utility functions
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ App.tsx                  # Main app component
â”œâ”€â”€ server/                       # Express backend
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ routes/                  # API route handlers
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ middleware/              # Express middleware
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ utils/                   # Utility functions
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ index.ts                 # Server entry point
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                         # Docusaurus documentation
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                    # Documentation markdown files
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/                     # Custom React components
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ docusaurus.config.ts     # Docusaurus configuration
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ sidebars.ts              # Documentation sidebar
â”œâ”€â”€ supabase/                     # Database migrations
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ migrations/              # SQL migration files
â”œâ”€â”€ scripts/                      # Utility scripts
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ reset-users.js           # Reset admin users
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ reset-app.js             # Complete database wipe
â”œâ”€â”€ nginx/                        # Nginx configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json                  # Root package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ vite.config.ts               # Vite configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ tsconfig.json                # TypeScript configuration
â””â”€â”€ .env.sample                  # Environment variables template

Environment Variablesâ€‹

Copy .env.sample to .env and configure:

# Supabase Configuration
VITE_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project-id.supabase.co
VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your-anon-key

# API Configuration
VITE_API_URL=http://localhost:3001/api

# Server Configuration
PORT=3001

# Frontend Configuration
FRONTEND_URL=http://localhost:5173

Database Setupâ€‹

See Setup Guide for complete database setup instructions.

Quick summary:

  1. Create Supabase project
  2. Run migration files in SQL Editor
  3. Verify tables were created

Hot Module Replacement (HMR)â€‹

Both frontend and backend support hot module replacement:

  • Frontend: Changes to React components automatically reload
  • Backend: Changes to Express routes automatically restart the server
  • Docs: Changes to documentation automatically reload

Debuggingâ€‹

Frontend Debuggingâ€‹

  1. Open browser DevTools (F12)
  2. Use React DevTools extension for component inspection
  3. Check Console tab for errors
  4. Use Network tab to inspect API calls

Backend Debuggingâ€‹

  1. Check terminal output for logs
  2. Add console.log() statements for debugging
  3. Use VS Code debugger with breakpoints
  4. Check /api endpoints with curl or Postman

Database Debuggingâ€‹

  1. Use Supabase SQL Editor to run queries
  2. Check Table Editor to view data
  3. Use Supabase Logs to see database activity

Common Tasksâ€‹

Adding a New Pageâ€‹

  1. Create component in src/pages/
  2. Add route in src/App.tsx
  3. Add navigation link in src/components/Navigation.tsx

Adding a New API Endpointâ€‹

  1. Create route handler in server/routes/
  2. Import and use in server/index.ts
  3. Add API client method in src/lib/api.ts

Adding Documentationâ€‹

  1. Create markdown file in docs/docs/
  2. Add to sidebar in docs/sidebars.ts
  3. Documentation automatically appears in docs site

Testingâ€‹

See Testing Guide for information on running tests.

Troubleshootingâ€‹

Port Already in Useâ€‹

# Find process using port 5173
lsof -i :5173

# Kill the process
kill -9 <PID>

Module Not Found Errorsâ€‹

# Clear node_modules and reinstall
rm -rf node_modules
yarn install

TypeScript Errorsâ€‹

# Run type checking
yarn typecheck

# Fix common issues
yarn lint --fix

Next Stepsâ€‹

  • Read Quick Start to get running
  • Check API Documentation for API reference
  • See Deployment Guide for production setup
